source_sentence: 南天竺國三藏菩提流志奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by imperial order from the Tripiṭaka of Southern India by Bodhiruci

source_sentence: 此文殊師利六字呪功能我今欲說。
translation: "Now, I want to explain the function of this six-syllable mantra of Mañjuśrī.
Suppose someone holds this dhāraṇī and wants to achieve it.
Either they will eat milk and milk, or they will eat vegetables.
Or he might eat fruit and milk.

source_sentence: 應食此食日別三時洗浴。
translation: They should eat this food and wash their hands at three separate times during the day.
The first time is after the fifth watch of the night.
After midnight is the second hour.

source_sentence: 黃昏已後至初夜為第三時。
translation: The third time is after dusk and into the early evening.
At each of these three times, you should bathe once.
Each puts on a separate set of pure clothing.
Therefore, he must also wear three sets of pure clothing.
Recite the dhāraṇī until it reaches 600,000 recitations.

source_sentence: 此為最初承事供養文殊。
translation: This is the first time he serves and makes offerings to Mañjuśrī.

His portrait of Mañjuśrī is of him sitting cross-legged on a lotus seat.
He's sitting cross-legged on the lotus seat.
He makes his right hand the hand that explains the teaching.
He puts his left hand in his arms and tilts it up.
The figure's body is shaped like a boy.
It's yellow-gold in color.
His celestial robes are white and cover his navel and below.
The rest of his body is exposed.

source_sentence: 首戴天冠身珮瓔珞臂印釧等。
translation: He wears a celestial crown on his head, and his body is adorned with ornaments, armlets, seals, and so forth.
It's adorned with a multitude of objects.
On the left side, he's depicted with a figure of Avalokitêśvara.

His ornaments, jewelry, and robes are adorned as usual.
He's sitting cross-legged on a lotus.
In his right hand, he holds a white whisk.
On the right side, he's depicted with the image of Samantabhadra Bodhisattva.
His body is golden in color.

source_sentence: 亦坐蓮華座右手執白拂。
translation: He's also sitting cross-legged on the lotus seat, holding a white whisk in his right hand.
On either side of Mañjuśrī in the sky, he creates a song in the Dharma assembly heaven.

He was holding a lotus garland in his hand.

On the right side of the ground beneath Mañjuśrī's image.

source_sentence: 其文殊師利等所坐華下遍畫作池水。
translation: A pool of water is painted all over the ground beneath the flowers on which Mañjuśrī and the others are sitting.
On either side of the bodhisattva's image, he's depicted on a mountain peak.
Each is depicted on a mountain peak.

source_sentence: 其畫師從起首欲畫之時。
translation: When the master painter first wanted to paint them, he took the eight precepts day by day.
He took the eight precepts every day.
He sprinkled himself, took a bath, put on pure robes, and painted.
He continued until he finished the painting.

source_sentence: 若有舍利塔即安文殊像。
translation: If there's a relics stūpa, then he places a statue of Mañjuśrī.
He should place the image on the west side of the stūpa facing west.
If there's no large stūpa, you should place it in a small stūpa.
In front of the image of Mañjuśrī, face west.

source_sentence: 設種種華種種飲食果子等。
translation: Set up a variety of flowers, foods, fruits, and so forth.
Offerings are made at three times.
A ghee lamp will be placed inside the site of the practice.
The site of the practice should be in a quiet place.
Only one person is allowed to make offerings.
When he's reciting a dhāraṇī in the place of practice, he must snap his fingers and ask for the required flowers, incense, and so forth.

source_sentence: 所須華香等彈指而索不得出言。
translation: He'll snap his fingers and ask for the necessary flowers and incense, and then he won't say anything.
He takes a scent of sunken water and cuts it into two fingers long.

source_sentence: 都盧婆香油(蘇合香稀者是)無烟佉陀羅木炭。
translation: It should be oil of turuṣka (a dilute form of sumac) and charcoal of smokeless khadira.
If it's not there, take purple quercus instead.
Replace it with purple quercus.

source_sentence: 於像前佉羅木炭火中燒盡一夜。
translation: It's burned in the fire in front of the image on khāra wood for the rest of the night.
When the brightness of the image emerges, he sees Mañjuśrī.
He then sees Mañjuśrī.
"All his aspirations are fulfilled.

Nothing outside of himself was at odds with what he sought.
Another teaching was to take sandalwood and cut off two long fingers and return them to the Buddha.
He takes a piece of sandalwood and cuts off two fingers of its length and returns it.
He burns it day and night and makes offerings to it.

source_sentence: 是時文殊師利即現身當為說法。
translation: Mañjuśrī then showed up in person and spoke to him.
All of his physical troubles were completely healed.
He attained full mastery over the bodhisattva stages.
He also did this in front of the image.
He smeared the ground with gomaya.
He scattered a multitude of name-dropping flowers.

source_sentence: 行者於塗地場內一邊坐。
translation: The practitioner sits to one side inside the painted ground.
He recites the dhāraṇī 108 times.

source_sentence: 經一月得聰明持一切經論。
translation: After one month, he attains the wisdom to uphold all the sūtras and śāstras.

source_sentence: 又法日日隨心常誦莫忘。
translation: He also recites the Dharma day by day according to his mind and doesn't forget it.
The results of karma that he's sure to receive will also cease.

source_sentence: 又法若日別能誦滿一百八遍。
translation: Also, if he recites the spell exactly one hundred and eight times a day, he'll see Mañjuśrī at the end of his life.

source_sentence: 臨命終時得見文殊師利。
translation: At the end of his life, he'll see Mañjuśrī.
Whatever his mind wishes, he'll be reborn.

source_sentence: 文殊師利為利益眾生故。
translation: Mañjuśrī does this for the benefit of sentient beings.
He briefly explains a few of these functions.

source_sentence: 宋藏此函更有六字神呪王經菩提流志譯者。
translation: This letter in the Song Canon also contains a translation of the six-syllable Incantation King Sutra by Bodhiruci.
The Danzang has none.
According to the Kaiyuan lucai letter, there is a translation of the Liuzi shenzhouwang jing pudiliuzhi in this letter.

source_sentence: 有六字神呪經菩提流志譯者。
translation: In the Kaiyuan lucei, there is a translation of the Liuzi shenzhou jing (Six Syllable Incantation) by Bodhiruci.

source_sentence: 云與陀羅尼集經第六卷文殊師利菩薩呪法及呪五首經六字陀羅尼等同本異譯。
translation: It says that it is a variant translation of the same six-syllable dhāraṇī as the sixth volume of the Dhāraṇī Collection Sutra, the Mañjuśrī Dhāraṇī of the Bodhisattva and the Dhāraṇī of the Five Heads of the Dhāraṇī.
This sūtra is the one that was collected.

source_sentence: 更無六字神呪王經說呪十首菩提流志譯者。
translation: There is no other translation of the six-syllable Incantation King Sutra that teaches the ten heads of the spell, Bodhiruci.
Now, I'm picking up this sūtra.

source_sentence: 即是知函中失譯人名今付梁錄者耳。
translation: This is the one who knew that the name of the translator was lost in the sūtras and is now being handed over to Liang Records.

source_sentence: 宋藏見彼題中有六字神呪之名。
translation: The Song Canon saw that the name of the six-syllable sūtra was in the title of the sūtra.

source_sentence: 遂濫同焉重編於此才函之中。
translation: He then misappropriated the same thing and retranscribed it into this letter of wisdom.
This was a mistake.

source_sentence: 而又妄安流志之名何耶。
translation: What was the point of falsely naming it Liuji?
